info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 3:57PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN CIBOLA AND NORTH CENTRAL CATRON COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM MDT... At 357 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Quemado, or 38 miles west of Datil, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Omega and Quemado. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 27 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
